name: profitably
content:

in a way that makes or is likely to make a profit: It was several months before the company started to trade profitably. It is hard to match such cheap fares profitably.
in a way that produces or is likely to produce an advantage: Use your time profitably. See
profitable
More examplesFewer examplesThey can operate more profitably by reducing their spending on advertising.The developed world can use energy much more efficiently and profitably.We need to decide a price at which this product could be profitably sold.They suggested he might profitably use his time behind bars reading a book.Are there parts of the curriculum that could profitably be revisited?
